_meta.description: Printer intelligence database: firmware quirks, material compatibility, calibration guidance, and known failure modes. Keyed by the same printer_id as safety_profiles.json.

PLA.notes: Standard settings.

PETG.notes: Reduce fan to avoid layer delamination.

TPU.notes: Print slowly (20-30mm/s). Disable retraction if bowden.

calibration.first_steps: Level bed, set Z-offset, run temperature tower for each filament brand.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube, measure wall thickness. Adjust flow multiplier = expected/measured.
calibration.retraction_test: Print retraction tower varying 0.5-6mm. Find shortest distance without stringing.

ender3.display_name: Creality Ender 3 / Ender 3 Pro / Ender 3 V2

PLA.notes: Sweet spot for stock PTFE hotend.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C to protect PTFE tube.

TPU.notes: Very difficult with bowden setup — print at 15-20mm/s, disable retraction.

quirks: PTFE tube degrades above 240°C — produces toxic fumes. Upgrade to all-metal hotend for higher temps.
Bowden tube couplers loosen over time — check and replace couplers every 6 months.
Stock bed springs are weak — upgrade to yellow springs or silicone spacers for stable leveling.
V2 uses a 32-bit board (4.2.2/4.2.7) — flash Marlin firmware for thermal runaway protection if not updated.
Extruder arm is plastic and cracks — inspect regularly, replace with aluminum extruder kit.

calibration.first_steps: Manual mesh bed leveling with paper method. Set Z-offset. Print bed level test pattern.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube at 200C. Target: 0.4mm wall = 0.4mm measured.
calibration.retraction_test: Bowden needs 4-6mm retraction at 45mm/s. Start at 5mm and tune down.
calibration.esteps: Stock e-steps often off by 5-10%. Measure 100mm extrusion, calibrate via M92 E<value> + M500.

failure_modes.cause: PTFE tube degradation or extruder arm crack
failure_modes.fix: Replace PTFE tube, inspect extruder arm for cracks

failure_modes.cause: Belt tension too loose or eccentric nuts too tight
failure_modes.fix: Tighten Y belt — should twang like guitar string. Adjust eccentric nuts until bed slides freely with no wobble

failure_modes.cause: Bed not level or Z-offset too high
failure_modes.fix: Re-level with paper method, lower Z-offset by 0.05mm increments

failure_modes.cause: Retraction too short for bowden setup
failure_modes.fix: Increase retraction to 5-6mm at 45mm/s

PLA.notes: Direct drive allows lower temps.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend safe at these temps.

ABS.notes: Print in enclosure or draft-free room.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU well — 30mm/s, 0.5mm retraction.

quirks: CR-Touch probe occasionally gives false readings — clean probe tip regularly.
Sprite extruder gear tension spring can be too tight for TPU — loosen one turn.
S1 Pro has a higher temp hotend (300C) than S1 (260C) — check your model before printing high-temp materials.

calibration.first_steps: Run CR-Touch auto-level. Fine-tune Z-offset with live babystep during first layer.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube at 205C. Direct drive usually needs 95-98% flow.
calibration.retraction_test: Start at 0.8mm retraction, 40mm/s. Sprite extruder rarely needs more than 1mm.

failure_modes.cause: Sprite extruder gear tension too loose or filament grinding
failure_modes.fix: Adjust gear tension screw. Clean extruder gears with brass brush.

failure_modes.cause: Heat creep in all-metal hotend
failure_modes.fix: Ensure heatsink fan runs at 100%. Print PETG at 230-235C, not higher.

PLA.notes: Higher temp than usual due to speed. Open door for PLA to avoid heat creep.

PETG.notes: Keep door closed. Reduce speed to 150mm/s for quality.

ABS.notes: Enclosed chamber ideal for ABS. Full speed OK.

TPU.notes: Reduce speed to 50-80mm/s for TPU.

quirks: Input shaping must be tuned per-machine — run ADXL345 calibration after any hardware changes.
Stock Klipper firmware is customized — community firmware (Guilouz) unlocks more features.
Print PLA with door open — enclosed chamber causes heat creep and jams at high speeds.
LIDAR on K1 Max sometimes miscalibrates — verify Z offset manually if first layer issues.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in self-test. Input shaping auto-tune. Verify Z offset with first layer print.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print flow tower at target speed. K1 volumetric flow varies significantly with speed.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.5mm retraction at 40mm/s is usually optimal. Don't exceed 1mm.

failure_modes.symptom: Filament jams during fast PLA printing
failure_modes.cause: Heat creep in enclosed chamber
failure_modes.fix: Open enclosure door for PLA. Ensure hotend fan is at 100%.

failure_modes.cause: Input shaping not tuned or belt tension off
failure_modes.fix: Re-run input shaper calibration. Check belt tension on both X and Y.

PLA.notes: Prusa's own PLA profiles are excellent.

PETG.notes: Prusament PETG at 240C/90C bed works perfectly.

ABS.notes: Enclosure strongly recommended. Prusa sells one.

ASA.notes: Similar to ABS. Better UV resistance for outdoor parts.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU well at 25-35mm/s.

quirks: PINDA probe is temperature-sensitive — first layer calibration varies with ambient temp. MK3S+ SuperPINDA is better.
Bondtech gears need cleaning every ~500h of printing — use brass brush.
Filament sensor (IR) can false-trigger with translucent filaments — can be disabled in firmware menu.
Stock textured PEI sheet works great for PETG but PLA sometimes sticks too well — use smooth sheet for PLA.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration (from LCD menu). This is the single most important calibration step.
calibration.flow_rate_test: PrusaSlicer bundles excellent calibration models — use built-in flow tower.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.8mm at 35mm/s is the factory default and rarely needs adjustment.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer height varies across bed
failure_modes.cause: PINDA probe thermal drift
failure_modes.fix: Upgrade to SuperPINDA. Or let printer warm up 10 min before printing.

failure_modes.cause: Partially clogged nozzle or cold pull needed
failure_modes.fix: Do cold pull with nylon at 285C → pull at 90C. Replace nozzle if persists.

PLA.notes: PrusaSlicer has native MK4 profiles. Use them.

PETG.notes: Nextruder handles PETG well at these temps.

ABS.notes: Enclosure recommended. MK4S improved part cooling.

TPU.notes: Nextruder is excellent for flexibles — 30-40mm/s.

quirks: Nextruder has extremely short retraction (0.4mm) — don't increase it, you'll cause jams.
Load cell bed probe is very accurate but sensitive to nozzle cleanliness — wipe nozzle before probing.
Input shaping enabled by default — don't add resonance compensation in slicer, it's firmware-level.
MK4S adds high-flow Nextruder — higher volumetric flow limits than MK4.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration from LCD. Then print calibration cube and measure dimensions.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Stock profiles are well-calibrated — adjust only if measuring wall width deviation > 0.02mm.
calibration.retraction_test: Do NOT change retraction from 0.4mm unless you have specific stringing issues. Nextruder is designed for this value.

failure_modes.cause: Load cell too sensitive or nozzle dirty
failure_modes.fix: Clean nozzle with brass brush before prints. Recalibrate load cell via Service menu.

failure_modes.cause: Retraction set too high (above 1mm)
failure_modes.fix: Reset retraction to 0.4mm in slicer profile. Nextruder requires very short retraction.

PLA.notes: Excellent PLA printer out of the box.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety. Works well otherwise.

ABS.notes: Marginal on stock PTFE hotend â€” 240C is the absolute max. No enclosure means warping risk on tall parts. Only recommended for small, low-profile prints.

TPU.notes: Bowden extruder makes flexibles challenging. Print very slowly (20mm/s), reduce retraction to 1.5mm max to avoid jams.

quirks: PTFE-lined hotend — same 240C limit as Ender 3. Upgrade to all-metal for higher temps.
SuperPINDA probe included on Mini+ — much better than original Mini's MINDA.
Small build volume (180x180x180) — plan part orientation carefully.
Bowden tube needs replacement every ~500h or if retraction quality drops.
WiFi can be unreliable — connection may drop after hours of operation. USB serial via OctoPrint is more stable for long sessions.
PrusaLink API key may need to be re-entered after firmware updates.

calibration.first_steps: Run first layer calibration from LCD. Mini's auto-level is reliable.
calibration.retraction_test: Bowden needs 3.2mm retraction at 70mm/s — these are good defaults.

failure_modes.symptom: Stringing after many hours of use
failure_modes.cause: Bowden tube gap at hotend develops
failure_modes.fix: Re-seat bowden tube. Cut clean end. Push flush against nozzle.

failure_modes.cause: Belt tension too loose or pulley grub screws loosened
failure_modes.fix: Check belt tension on both X and Y axes. Tighten grub screws on motor pulleys with included hex key.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer adhesion fails after firmware update
failure_modes.cause: Z-offset/first layer calibration reset by firmware
failure_modes.fix: Re-run first layer calibration from LCD menu (Calibration > First Layer Calibration).

failure_modes.cause: WiFi instability on Mini's built-in ESP module
failure_modes.fix: Move printer closer to router, or use USB serial via OctoPrint on a Raspberry Pi for reliable monitoring.

PLA.notes: Open door for PLA on long prints to prevent heat creep.

PETG.notes: Enclosed chamber helps with PETG bed adhesion.

ABS.notes: Excellent enclosed ABS printing. Chamber pre-heat recommended.

ASA.notes: Same as ABS profile. Great outdoor part material.

TPU.notes: Reduce speed to 60-80mm/s for TPU. Direct drive handles it well.

PA-CF.notes: Carbon fiber nylon — requires hardened nozzle (included). Chamber heated.

PC.notes: Polycarbonate needs full enclosure and dry filament.

quirks: LiDAR first-layer detection can reject prints with textured top surfaces — disable 'first layer inspection' for affected models.
AMS (auto material system) has trouble with flexible filaments — feed TPU manually through the direct path.
Hardened steel nozzle included — lower thermal conductivity means slightly higher temps needed vs brass.
Firmware updates can change behavior — check Bambu wiki after updates.
MQTT protocol for control — Kiln's Bambu adapter handles this natively.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration sequence (vibration, flow, first layer). It's very thorough.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Bambu's auto-flow calibration is excellent. Only manual-tune if switching to non-Bambu filament.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.5mm at 30mm/s is factory-optimal. Don't change unless experiencing specific issues.

failure_modes.cause: AMS buffer tangled or spool resistance too high
failure_modes.fix: Check AMS buffer tube for kinks. Ensure spool rotates freely. Use AMS-friendly spool holders.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer adhesion failure with engineering materials
failure_modes.cause: Build plate not clean or chamber not pre-heated
failure_modes.fix: Clean with IPA. Pre-heat chamber by running bed at 100C for 10 min before print.

PLA.notes: Same as X1C. Open door for PLA.

PETG.notes: Enclosed printing works well.

ABS.notes: Enclosed chamber for ABS. Pre-heat recommended.

quirks: No LiDAR — can't do first layer inspection. Manually verify first layer quality.
Same mechanical platform as X1C — reliability and print quality are identical.
AMS compatible — same considerations as X1C for flexible filaments.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration. No LiDAR auto-detection, so manual first layer check is important.

PLA.notes: Great PLA printer out of the box.

PETG.notes: Open frame — draft-free room recommended for PETG.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Reduce speed to 50mm/s.

quirks: Open frame — no ABS printing without aftermarket enclosure.
AMS Lite compatible (4-slot) — different from X1C full AMS.
Bed-slinger design — heavier parts may shift at very high accelerations.
Slightly lower max speeds than X1C/P1S due to bed-slinger kinematics.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration from touchscreen. Simple and effective.

failure_modes.cause: Bed-slinger Y acceleration too high for heavy parts
failure_modes.fix: Reduce Y acceleration in slicer for prints taller than 100mm or with heavy infill.

PLA.notes: Open panels or remove top hat for PLA to prevent heat creep.

PETG.notes: Enclosed chamber benefits PETG adhesion.

ABS.notes: This is what Vorons are built for. Chamber target 50-60C.

ASA.notes: Same as ABS approach. Excellent results.

PA-CF.notes: Requires hardened nozzle. Chamber heated. Dry filament critical.

quirks: Kit printer — quality depends heavily on build quality. Follow the manual precisely.
Input shaping MUST be tuned with accelerometer (ADXL345) — pre-built configurations don't transfer between machines.
Z offset varies with chamber temperature — set it after chamber has reached target temp.
Afterburner/Stealthburner toolhead choice significantly affects max flow rate and cooling performance.

calibration.first_steps: Input shaping calibration with ADXL345. Pressure advance tuning. Z offset with warm chamber.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Critical for Vorons — volumetric flow varies hugely by hotend choice (Dragon vs Rapido vs Mosquito).
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.3-0.6mm retraction. Heavily depends on hotend — tune empirically.

failure_modes.cause: Gantry not square, belt tension uneven, or Z motors not synced
failure_modes.fix: Re-square gantry per Voron docs. Check belt tension. Run Z tilt adjust (QGL for 2.4, Z_TILT for Trident).

failure_modes.cause: Chamber too hot, heater PID not tuned for chamber temps
failure_modes.fix: Re-tune PID with chamber at target temp. Ensure thermistor readings are accurate.

PLA.notes: Good PLA performance at high speeds.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend handles PETG well.

TPU.notes: Direct drive. Print at 30-40mm/s.

quirks: Klipper firmware — access Mainsail/Fluidd interface via printer's IP address.
Input shaping pre-configured but may need re-tuning if you modify the printer.
PEI build plate works great but needs IPA cleaning between prints.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level from screen. Input shaping usually pre-configured — verify with test print.

PLA.notes: Open enclosure door for PLA. High-speed capable.

PETG.notes: Enclosed environment works well. All-metal hotend.

ABS.notes: Enclosed chamber. Active chamber heating available.

TPU.notes: Direct drive. Print at 30-40mm/s for best results.

ASA.notes: Enclosed chamber ideal for ASA. Similar to ABS settings.

quirks: Uses SDCP protocol — communicates via WebSocket on port 3030.
No authentication required on LAN.
File upload works via HTTP pull — printer fetches from a URL you provide.
Camera stream available via SDCP enable command.
Centauri Carbon 2 runs its own MQTT broker on port 1883 (max 4 connections).

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level and vibration compensation from touchscreen. Input shaping pre-configured.

failure_modes.cause: Printer firmware may not support SDCP or is in a different network mode
failure_modes.fix: Ensure printer firmware is up to date. Check printer is on same subnet. Try UDP discovery (M99999 on port 3000).

failure_modes.symptom: Upload command succeeds but printer never downloads the file
failure_modes.cause: Printer cannot reach the local HTTP server (firewall, different subnet)
failure_modes.fix: Ensure no firewall blocks the ephemeral port. Verify printer and host are on same network segment.

PLA.notes: Large-format printing. Standard PLA settings.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend. Good for large structural parts.

quirks: 800x800x1000mm build volume — one of the largest consumer FDM printers.
Klipper firmware with Moonraker — use moonraker adapter type, not elegoo.
Quad-Z lead screws — ensure all four are properly leveled.

calibration.first_steps: Run mesh bed leveling. Verify all four Z-axes are level. Input shaping calibration recommended.

PLA.notes: Open door for PLA to manage chamber temp.

PETG.notes: Enclosed environment good for PETG.

PA-CF.notes: High-temp hotend (350C rated) handles PA-CF. Use hardened nozzle.

quirks: Custom Klipper firmware — some community macros may not work.
350C-rated hotend is one of the highest on the market — great for engineering materials.
Chamber heater available — reaches 60C+ for ABS/PC.

calibration.first_steps: Run QIDI's built-in calibration suite. Input shaping and pressure advance auto-tune available.

PLA.notes: Standard PLA settings. Works well on most Klipper setups.

PETG.notes: Reduce fan for better layer adhesion.

ABS.notes: Enclosure strongly recommended for ABS. Use draft shield in slicer if open-frame.

TPU.notes: Direct drive recommended. Print at 25-40mm/s.

ASA.notes: Similar to ABS. Enclosure recommended for best results.

quirks: Use RESTART instead of M999 to restart firmware — Klipper does not support M999.
Pressure advance replaces linear advance — set via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=<value>.
Use SET_HEATER_TEMPERATURE for async heating — does not block like M109/M190.
Bed mesh calibration via BED_MESH_CALIBRATE macro — run after bed reaches target temperature.
Input shaper tuning recommended for high-speed printing — requires ADXL345 accelerometer for best results.

calibration.first_steps: Home all axes. Run BED_MESH_CALIBRATE. Set Z offset with PROBE_CALIBRATE. Save with SAVE_CONFIG.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube. Measure wall thickness. Adjust flow multiplier in slicer.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: start at 0.4-0.8mm retraction. Tune with retraction tower.
calibration.pressure_advance: Print pressure advance tuning tower. Set via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE ADVANCE=<value>. Save with SAVE_CONFIG.

failure_modes.cause: MCU cannot keep up with step rate — speed or acceleration too high for the board
failure_modes.fix: Lower max velocity/acceleration in printer.cfg. Upgrade to a faster MCU board if persistent.

failure_modes.symptom: ADC out of range error on startup
failure_modes.cause: Thermistor wiring issue or thermistor disconnected
failure_modes.fix: Check thermistor wiring connections. Verify thermistor type matches printer.cfg sensor_type setting.

failure_modes.symptom: Stepper motor buzzing but not moving
failure_modes.cause: Stepper driver current too low or wiring issue
failure_modes.fix: Check run_current in printer.cfg TMC section. Verify stepper wiring — swap two middle wires if motor vibrates in place.

failure_modes.cause: USB connection unstable or MCU overloaded
failure_modes.fix: Use a high-quality USB cable. Avoid USB hubs. Check dmesg for USB disconnect events. Consider UART/CAN connection.

failure_modes.cause: Probe wiring loose or probe triggered during travel
failure_modes.fix: Check probe wiring. Increase probe travel height (probe_hop). Ensure probe is not triggering from bed vibration.

PLA.notes: Same PTFE hotend as Ender 3. Excellent PLA performance.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety.

TPU.notes: Difficult with bowden — print at 15-20mm/s, disable retraction.

quirks: Cube-frame design makes it quieter than Ender 3 but harder to access prints.
Ender 5 Plus has BLTouch for ABL — standard Ender 5 requires manual leveling.
PTFE tube degrades above 240°C — same limit as Ender 3.
Bowden tube is longer than Ender 3 — may need slightly higher retraction (6mm).
Z-axis lead screw can develop wobble over time — ensure anti-backlash nut is snug.

calibration.first_steps: Manual bed leveling with paper method. Ender 5 Plus: run BLTouch auto-level.
calibration.retraction_test: Bowden needs 5-6mm retraction at 45mm/s. Longer tube than Ender 3 may need 6mm.
calibration.esteps: Same extruder as Ender 3 — calibrate e-steps via M92 E<value>.

failure_modes.cause: Lead screw bent or anti-backlash nut worn
failure_modes.fix: Check lead screw straightness. Replace anti-backlash nut. Ensure coupler is aligned.

failure_modes.cause: Stock springs too weak for heavy glass bed
failure_modes.fix: Upgrade to stiffer yellow springs or silicone spacers.

PLA.notes: Large bed takes longer to heat — allow 5-10 min for even temp.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety. Works well on large bed.

TPU.notes: Bowden makes flexibles difficult. Very slow speeds (15mm/s), minimal retraction.

quirks: Large bed can have significant temperature variation across surface — use glass bed or PEI sheet for flatness.
Long bowden tube (>50cm) requires higher retraction (6-7mm).
PTFE tube degrades above 240°C — upgrade to all-metal hotend for ABS/PETG at higher temps.
CR-10S adds filament runout sensor and dual Z lead screws — improved stability.
Stock Marlin may lack thermal runaway protection — flash updated firmware immediately.

calibration.first_steps: Manual mesh bed leveling. Large bed needs extra attention to corners. Use glass bed for flatness.
calibration.retraction_test: Long bowden tube needs 6-7mm retraction at 40mm/s.
calibration.esteps: Calibrate e-steps — stock extruder often under-extrudes by 5-10%.

failure_modes.cause: Bed temperature uneven on large surface area
failure_modes.fix: Print with brim. Verify bed temp with IR thermometer at corners. Consider enclosure.

failure_modes.cause: PTFE tube degradation or plastic extruder arm crack
failure_modes.fix: Replace PTFE tube. Upgrade to metal extruder arm.

PLA.notes: Remove top hat or open panels for PLA to avoid heat creep in tiny enclosure.

PETG.notes: Enclosed chamber helps adhesion. Small volume limits part size.

ABS.notes: Enclosed design ideal for ABS. Chamber heats up quickly due to small volume.

ASA.notes: Similar to ABS. Voron 0 is great for small ASA parts.

quirks: Tiny build volume (120x120x120) — plan parts carefully. Ideal for small functional prints.
Kit build — quality depends on build precision. Follow Voron assembly docs closely.
No Z probe by default — manual Z offset with paper method or aftermarket probe.
Mini Stealthburner toolhead — lower max flow rate than full Stealthburner.
Enclosed volume heats up very fast — excellent for ABS but can overheat PLA quickly.

calibration.first_steps: Manual Z offset calibration. Input shaping with ADXL345 strongly recommended.
calibration.pressure_advance: Tune pressure advance per-filament. Critical for print quality at speed.
calibration.retraction_test: Mini Stealthburner: 0.3-0.5mm retraction. Very short for direct drive.

failure_modes.cause: Mini Stealthburner hitting volumetric flow limit
failure_modes.fix: Reduce speed or upgrade hotend. Stock Mini SB maxes out around 10-12mm³/s.

failure_modes.cause: Build plate adhesion issue or Z offset too high
failure_modes.fix: Clean bed with IPA. Re-calibrate Z offset. For ABS, let chamber soak at temp 10 min before printing.

PLA.notes: Large bed takes longer to heat evenly. Allow soak time.

PETG.notes: Good PETG performance. Draft-free room recommended (open frame).

ABS.notes: Open frame — requires aftermarket enclosure for ABS. Available from Rat Rig.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU well. Print at 25-40mm/s.

quirks: Kit printer with 3-point bed leveling — ensure kinematic mounts are properly seated.
EVA toolhead platform — many toolhead options. Performance varies by hotend choice.
Open-frame CoreXY — fast and accurate but needs enclosure for ABS.
Beacon or Klicky probe common — configure in Klipper's printer.cfg.
Large build volume models (400+mm) may need re-squared gantry after shipping.

calibration.first_steps: Home axes, run bed mesh calibrate, set Z offset via PROBE_CALIBRATE, SAVE_CONFIG.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Varies by EVA toolhead hotend — test volumetric flow empirically.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.4-0.8mm retraction depending on hotend.
calibration.pressure_advance: Tune per-filament. Print PA tower for best results.

failure_modes.symptom: First layer inconsistency across large bed
failure_modes.cause: Bed mesh not compensating enough or kinematic mounts shifted
failure_modes.fix: Re-run BED_MESH_CALIBRATE with finer probe grid (7x7 or 9x9). Check kinematic mount tightness.

failure_modes.cause: Belt tension uneven or rail alignment off
failure_modes.fix: Re-tension belts evenly. Verify linear rails are parallel using straight edge.

PLA.notes: Excellent budget PLA printer.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety. Direct drive helps with retraction.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU decently. Print at 25-30mm/s.

quirks: PTFE-lined hotend limits max temp to 240°C — upgrade to all-metal for ABS.
Neptune 3 Pro adds auto-leveling (CR-Touch) — standard Neptune 3 is manual leveling.
Neptune 3 Plus has a larger bed (320x320) — check your specific model for correct dimensions.
PEI magnetic build plate works well but needs cleaning with IPA between prints.
Direct drive extruder is a nice upgrade over bowden-based budget printers.

calibration.first_steps: Pro/Plus: run auto-level from menu. Standard: manual leveling with paper method.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 1-2mm retraction at 40mm/s. Much less than bowden printers.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Print single-wall cube. Adjust flow multiplier.

failure_modes.cause: CR-Touch probe needs recalibration or nozzle residue interfering
failure_modes.fix: Clean nozzle tip. Re-run auto-level. Ensure probe deploys freely.

failure_modes.cause: PTFE tube swelling at higher temps
failure_modes.fix: Print PETG at 225-230C max. Replace PTFE tube if deformed.

PLA.notes: Excellent high-speed PLA printing. 250mm/s capable.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend handles PETG well. Reduce speed for quality.

TPU.notes: Direct drive. Print at 30-50mm/s for TPU.

quirks: Proprietary firmware — limited community modification options.
Built-in camera for timelapse and monitoring via AnkerMake app.
M5C is the budget version — no camera, no auto-level, but same speed capability.
High-speed printing requires well-tuned input shaping — factory calibrated.
AnkerMake slicer recommended but PrusaSlicer/OrcaSlicer work with manual profile setup.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in auto-level and vibration compensation from touchscreen.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Factory calibration is usually good. Only adjust if measuring wall deviation.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.8mm at 40mm/s is a good starting point for the direct drive extruder.

failure_modes.cause: Input shaping needs recalibration
failure_modes.fix: Re-run vibration compensation from printer menu.

failure_modes.cause: Z offset needs adjustment or bed not clean
failure_modes.fix: Clean PEI sheet with IPA. Adjust Z offset in 0.05mm increments.

artillery_sw_x3.display_name: Artillery Sidewinder X3 Plus / X3 Pro

PLA.notes: Large bed (300x300). Allow extra heat soak time.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend. Good PETG performance on large bed.

ABS.notes: Open frame — enclosure recommended for ABS. Draft shield in slicer as minimum.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. 25-40mm/s.

quirks: Klipper firmware with custom Artillery modifications — access via Mainsail/Fluidd web UI.
Large 300x300mm bed — auto-level probe essential for consistent first layers.
X3 Pro has higher-speed capability than X3 Plus — check your model for max speeds.
Direct drive extruder with all-metal hotend — capable of engineering materials.
PEI build plate needs regular IPA cleaning for reliable adhesion.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level from touchscreen. Input shaping may be pre-configured — verify with test print.
calibration.pressure_advance: Tune via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE. Important for quality at speed.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.5-0.8mm retraction.

failure_modes.symptom: Uneven first layer on large prints
failure_modes.cause: Bed mesh needs finer probe grid for 300x300 surface
failure_modes.fix: Re-run BED_MESH_CALIBRATE with 7x7 or 9x9 grid.

failure_modes.cause: USB connection to MCU unstable
failure_modes.fix: Use high-quality USB cable. Avoid USB hubs.

PLA.notes: Excellent PLA printer. MK3S-like performance at a fraction of the price.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend handles PETG well.

ABS.notes: All-metal hotend supports ABS temps. Enclosure needed to prevent warping.

TPU.notes: Planetary gear direct drive handles TPU well. 25-35mm/s.

quirks: Often called a 'MK3S clone' — similar dual-gear extruder and probe-based leveling.
SV06 Plus has a larger bed (300x300) vs standard (220x220).
Planetary gear extruder provides strong grip but can grind soft filaments if tension is too high.
PEI spring steel sheet included — dual-sided (smooth and textured).
Active community with custom Marlin firmware builds for additional features.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level from LCD. Fine-tune Z offset during first layer print.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.6-1.0mm retraction at 40mm/s.
calibration.esteps: Stock e-steps usually accurate but verify with 100mm extrusion test.

failure_modes.cause: Extruder gear tension too high for the material
failure_modes.fix: Loosen tension screw. Softer filaments (TPU) need lighter grip.

failure_modes.cause: Probe mount screws loosening from vibration
failure_modes.fix: Tighten probe mounting screws. Re-run auto-level.

PLA.notes: Klipper enables high-speed PLA printing.

PETG.notes: All-metal hotend. Good PETG performance.

ABS.notes: Open frame — enclosure recommended for ABS.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Print at 25-40mm/s.

quirks: Klipper firmware — access Mainsail/Fluidd web interface via printer IP.
SV07 Plus has a large bed (300x300) vs standard (220x220).
Input shaping pre-configured — may need re-tuning after modifications.
Sonic pad / MCU board may have limited community firmware support.
OctoPrint not needed — Moonraker/Mainsail built into the printer.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-level from touchscreen. Verify Z offset. Input shaping usually pre-tuned.
calibration.pressure_advance: Tune via SET_PRESSURE_ADVANCE for best quality at speed.
calibration.retraction_test: Direct drive: 0.5-0.8mm retraction.

failure_modes.symptom: Print quality degrades at high speed
failure_modes.cause: Input shaping not properly tuned for the specific machine
failure_modes.fix: Re-run input shaper calibration. Attach ADXL345 for best results.

failure_modes.cause: Moonraker service crashed or network configuration issue
failure_modes.fix: Power cycle printer. Check network settings via touchscreen.

PLA.notes: Good high-speed PLA printer. Open door for PLA to manage chamber heat.

PETG.notes: Keep below 240C for PTFE safety on standard model. 5M Pro has all-metal hotend.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Print at 30-40mm/s.

quirks: PTFE-lined hotend on standard 5M (280C max). 5M Pro has all-metal hotend for higher temps.
Klipper firmware with FlashForge modifications — limited community customization.
Enclosed design good for draft-sensitive materials.
Quick-swap nozzle system — convenient but proprietary nozzle format.
FlashPrint slicer recommended by manufacturer but OrcaSlicer has community profiles.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in auto-calibration from touchscreen. Vibration compensation auto-tuned.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Factory calibration usually sufficient. Adjust if switching filament brands.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.5-0.8mm retraction for direct drive.

failure_modes.cause: PTFE tube swelling at higher temps (standard 5M only)
failure_modes.fix: Print PETG at 225-230C max on standard model. Upgrade to 5M Pro for higher temps.

failure_modes.cause: Nozzle not seated properly in quick-swap mechanism
failure_modes.fix: Remove and re-seat nozzle. Ensure it clicks into place. Tighten if thread-based.

PLA.notes: Open door/panels for PLA. Segmented heatbed heats only used area.

PETG.notes: Nextruder handles PETG well.

ABS.notes: Enclosed design excellent for ABS. Segmented bed reduces heat-up time.

ASA.notes: Same approach as ABS. Great for large outdoor parts.

PA-CF.notes: Hardened nozzle required. Enclosed chamber. Dry filament critical.

quirks: Segmented heatbed — only heats zones under the print, saving energy and time.
Up to 5 tool heads — multi-material/multi-color without purge tower waste.
Nextruder toolhead — same 0.4mm retraction rule as MK4. Don't increase it.
Load cell bed probe per-toolhead — each tool calibrates independently.
Very large build volume (360x360x360) — ensure model fits before slicing.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in calibration wizard. Each toolhead calibrates its own Z offset.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Stock profiles well-calibrated. Per-toolhead flow adjustment available.
calibration.retraction_test: 0.4mm retraction per Nextruder. Same as MK4 — do not increase.

failure_modes.symptom: Tool change leaves blob on print
failure_modes.cause: Wipe tower calibration off or nozzle not clean
failure_modes.fix: Recalibrate tool offsets. Ensure wipe tower is enabled in slicer.

failure_modes.symptom: Segmented bed zone boundary visible in first layer
failure_modes.cause: Temperature difference at zone boundaries
failure_modes.fix: Allow extra bed soak time (5-10 min) for zones to equalize.

PLA.notes: Excellent high-speed PLA performance.

PETG.notes: Open frame — draft-free room recommended.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Reduce speed to 50mm/s.

quirks: Open frame — no ABS without aftermarket enclosure.
Same CoreXY mechanics as X1C/P1S but exposed — keep area clean.
AMS compatible but no enclosure means drafts can affect multi-material prints.
MQTT control via Kiln's Bambu adapter — LAN mode must be enabled.
Aftermarket enclosure kits available from Bambu and third parties.

calibration.first_steps: Run built-in auto-calibration from touchscreen.
calibration.flow_rate_test: Auto-flow calibration included. Re-run when changing filament brands.

failure_modes.cause: No enclosure — ambient air cooling causes differential shrinkage
failure_modes.fix: Add aftermarket enclosure. Or switch to draft-resistant materials (PLA, PETG).

PLA.notes: Compact but fast PLA printer.

PETG.notes: Open frame. Good PETG results in draft-free room.

TPU.notes: Direct drive handles TPU. Print at 30-50mm/s.

quirks: Small build volume (180x180x180) — same as Prusa Mini. Plan parts carefully.
AMS Lite compatible (4-slot) for multi-color prints.
Open frame — no ABS without enclosure.
Bed-slinger Y axis — heavy parts may shift at max acceleration.
State values sent as UPPERCASE via MQTT — Kiln adapter normalizes this.

calibration.first_steps: Run auto-calibration from touchscreen. Very quick and reliable.

failure_modes.cause: Y-axis acceleration too aggressive for bed-slinger with heavy part
failure_modes.fix: Reduce acceleration for tall or heavy prints.
